actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to provide that the value added to the private real estate of any person who is protected by the Secret Service under section 3056 of title 18 of the United States Code, by reason of any improvement made at Government expense, other than an improvement reasonably related to the security or protection of such persons, shall be recoverable by the United States and constitutes a lien against the real estate so improved.

summary.text: Provides that the value added to the private real estate of any person who is protected by the Secret Service by reason of any improvement made at Government expense, other than an improvement reasonably related to the security or portection of such persons, shall be recoverable by the United States and constitute a lien against the real estate so improved.

titles.title: A bill to provide that the value added to the private real estate of any person who is protected by the Secret Service under section 3056 of title 18 of the United States Code, by reason of any improvement made at Government expense, other than an improvement reasonably related to the security or protection of such persons, shall be recoverable by the United States and constitutes a lien against the real estate so improved.
